Author: strongbutkindahungry
Text: I log my apple watch workouts (i usually chose 'other' for mine as that's one of the few that are compatible with MFP that isn't running or cycling) and then as a rule for myself I eat back a quarter of the calories.  &#x200B;  My workouts are usually around 800-900 from my watch so I eat back around 200 with the thought process that even if the watch isn't accurate I must have burned at least more than a quarter of what it said, and training does leave me much more hungry

Author: tulipsandmothballs
Text: I log mine from Apple Watch automatically and it only makes it to MFP like 50% of the time. If I go run it shows up, if I do a hiit session it doesn’t. I never allow myself to eat back exercise unless it’s a situation I absolutely cannot avoid.
